page.title: 19SPREYTON PLAYING FIELDS
page.content: The playing field in Spreyton was given to the village in 1972 by Viscount Lambert as a memorial to his son,the Honourable George Lambert.Viscount Lambert used to live in Spreyton and still takes an interest in the area.It is owned by a Trust and is used as a recreation ground.It is managed by a committee of management representing a cross section of the village. In the playing field there is a football pitch,a tennis court,a see-saw,some swings,a slide and a climbing frame.Every year the committee and the village get together to raise funds for the playing field and grants are given to them by the Parish Council to maintain it.The field is used for the Spreyton Spree in July and with the Village Hall Committee for the Annual show.
